definitions.definition: To raise (something) to a higher position.
definitions.example: The doctor told me elevating my legs would help reduce the swelling.

definitions.definition: To promote (someone) to a higher rank.
To confer honor or nobility on (someone).
definitions.example: The traditional worldview elevates man as the pinnacle of creation.

definitions.definition: To make (something or someone) more worthy or of greater value.
definitions.example: A talented chef can elevate everyday ingredients into gourmet delights.

definitions.definition: To direct (the mind, thoughts, etc.) toward more worthy things.
To increase the intensity or degree of (something).
definitions.example: Some drugs have the side effect of elevating your blood sugar level.

definitions.definition: To intoxicate in a slight degree; to make (someone) tipsy.
(Latinism) To attempt to make (something) seem less important, remarkable, etc.
